ygData.subject: RE: Jewelery
ygData.msgSnippet: Add 2p to each of those prices. That s what I sell them for, and I don t have any problems. Just use those prices as a guideline though. If someone is nice and
ygData.messageBody:
Add 2p to each of those prices. That's what I sell them for, and I don't
have any problems. Just use those prices as a guideline though. If someone
is nice and polite, knock off a little. If they are rude and demanding,
don't budge an inch.

On a related note: Do NOT make any enchanted jewelry unless you have a buyer
for it. People not following that simple guideline are largely responsible
for the plummeting prices. (I.E., Tradesman makes 10 +2 int rings. Sells 2
right off the bat for 8p each. 2 hours later he still has 8 rings. He drops
his price to 7p each. No takers. An hour later, frustrated and just wanting
to unload the things he drops his price to 5p each. Sells 4 of em. Still has
4. Does a special auction at 3p each to free up his inventory slots. Now
EVERYONE expects those +2 int rings to sell for 3p. Get the picture?)

Sorry... kinda ranted a little there...

Qinie Isil'Goren
High Elf Enchantress

> -----Original Message-----
> From: duffjc@... [SMTP:duffjc@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 05, 1999 12:57 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqenchanters] Jewelery
>
> From: duffjc@...
>
> I have searched back a couple digests, and haven't
> found an answer and figured this would be quicker.
> I am an Enchanter on the Karana server, and have
> a Jewelery skill lvl of about 41. I have been
> making enchanted jeweler for a while, but don't
> really have a firm grasp on what kind of base
> prices I should be charging. Here is a list of
> prices I am charging now. Could I get some
> feedback on what others are charging, and maybe
> set up a Merchants Co-operative to set prices for
> our market on Karana.
>
> +2 Agility rings 3pp
> +2 Dexterity Braclets 4pp
> +2 int rings 5pp
> +2 strength rings 6pp
> Jaded Silver rings 7pp
>
> I usually give up to 1pp off if someone buys 2 at
> a time. Just wondering what the rest of you sell
> for. I don't want to undercut the market, but
> then again I Don't want to sell to high.
>
> I think if we set up a Jewelery Co-operative we
> may be able to set higher prices for our wares.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Sinth the Enchanter
>
>
